delete.summary: Deletes a backup routine from the configuration by name.

put.summary: Updates an existing routine in the configuration.

delete.summary: Deletes a storage from the configuration by name.

put.summary: Updates an existing storage in the configuration.

model.AerospikeCluster.description: AerospikeCluster represents the configuration for an Aerospike cluster for backup.

connection-queue-size.description: Specifies the size of the Aerospike Connection Queue per node.

credentials.description: The authentication details to the Aerospike cluster.

use-services-alternate.description: Whether should use "services-alternate" instead of "services" in info request during cluster tending.

model.BackupDetails.description: BackupDetails contains information about a backup.

byte-count.description: The size of the backup in bytes.

created.description: The backup time in the ISO 8601 format.

file-count.description: The number of backup files created.

from.description: The lower time bound of backup entities in the ISO 8601 format (for incremental backups).

key.description: The path to the backup files.

record-count.description: The total number of records backed up.

secondary-index-count.description: The number of secondary indexes backed up.

udf-count.description: The number of UDF files backed up.

model.BackupPolicy.description: BackupPolicy represents a scheduled backup policy.

bandwidth.description:
Throttles backup write operations to the backup file(s) to not exceed the given
bandwidth in MiB/s.

file-limit.description:
File size limit (in MB) for the backup directory. If an .asb backup file crosses this size threshold,
a new backup file will be created.

max-records.description: An approximate limit for the number of records to process. Available in server 4.9 and above.

max-retries.description: Maximum number of retries before aborting the current transaction.

no-bins.description: Only backup record metadata (digest, TTL, generation count, key).

no-indexes.description: Do not back up any secondary index definitions.

no-records.description: Do not back up any record data (metadata or bin data).

no-udfs.description: Do not back up any UDF modules.

parallel.description: Maximum number of scan calls to run in parallel.

records-per-second.description:
Limit total returned records per second (RPS). If RPS is zero (the default),
the records-per-second limit is not applied.

remove-artifacts.description: Clear directory or remove output file.

remove-files.description: Whether to clear the output directory (default: KeepAll).

retry-delay.description: RetryDelay defines the delay in milliseconds before retrying a failed operation.

sealed.description:
Sealed determines whether backup should include keys updated during the backup process.
When true, the backup contains only records that last modified before backup started.
When false (default), records updated during backup might be included in the backup, but it's not guaranteed.

socket-timeout.description:
Socket timeout in milliseconds. If this value is 0, it is set to total-timeout.
If both are 0, there is no socket idle time limit.

total-timeout.description: Total socket timeout in milliseconds. Default is 0, that is, no timeout.

model.BackupRoutine.description: BackupRoutine represents a scheduled backup operation routine.

backup-policy.description: The name of the corresponding backup policy.

bin-list.description: The list of backup bin names (optional, an empty list implies backing up all bins).

incr-interval-cron.description: The interval for incremental backup as a cron expression string (optional).

interval-cron.description: The interval for full backup as a cron expression string.

namespaces.description: The list of the namespaces to back up (optional, empty list implies backup up whole cluster).

partition-list.description:
Back up list of partition filters. Partition filters can be ranges, individual partitions,
or records after a specific digest within a single partition.
Default number of partitions to back up: 0 to 4095: all partitions.

prefer-racks.description: A list of Aerospike Server rack IDs to prefer when reading records for a backup.

secret-agent.description: The Secret Agent configuration for the routine (optional).

set-list.description: The list of backup set names (optional, an empty list implies backing up all sets).

source-cluster.description: The name of the corresponding source cluster.

storage.description: The name of the corresponding storage provider configuration.

model.BackupServiceConfig.description: BackupServiceConfig represents the backup service configuration properties.

http.description: HTTPServer is the backup service HTTP server configuration.

logger.description: Logger is the backup service logger configuration.

level.description: The compression level to use (or -1 if unspecified).

mode.description: The compression mode to be used (default is NONE).

model.Config.description: Config represents the service configuration file.

model.Credentials.description: Credentials represents authentication details to the Aerospike cluster.

auth-mode.description: The authentication mode string (INTERNAL, EXTERNAL, EXTERNAL_INSECURE, PKI).

password.description: The password for the cluster authentication.

password-path.description: The file path with the password string, will take precedence over the password field.

user.description: The username for the cluster authentication.

full.description: Full represents the state of a full backup. Nil if no full backup is running.

incremental.description: Incremental represents the state of an incremental backup. Nil if no incremental backup is running.

key-env.description: The name of the environment variable containing the encryption key.

key-file.description: The path to the file containing the encryption key.

key-secret.description: The secret keyword in Aerospike Secret Agent containing the encryption key.

mode.description: The encryption mode to be used (NONE, AES128, AES256)

model.FileLoggerConfig.description: FileLoggerConfig represents the configuration for the file logger writer.

compress.description:
Compress determines if the rotated log files should be compressed
using gzip. The default is not to perform compression.

filename.description: Filename is the file to write logs to.

maxage.description:
MaxAge is the maximum number of days to retain old log files based on the
timestamp encoded in their filename. The default is not to remove old log files
based on age.

maxbackups.description:
MaxBackups is the maximum number of old log files to retain. The default
is to retain all old log files.

maxsize.description: MaxSize is the maximum size in megabytes of the log file before it gets rotated.

model.HTTPServerConfig.description: HTTPServerConfig represents the service's HTTP server configuration.

context-path.description: ContextPath customizes path for the API endpoints.

model.LoggerConfig.description: LoggerConfig represents the backup service logger configuration.

format.description: Format is the logger format (PLAIN, JSON).

stdout-writer.description: Whether to enable logging to the standard output.

model.RateLimiterConfig.description: RateLimiterConfig is the HTTP server rate limiter configuration.

size.description: Rate limiter token bucket size (bursts threshold).

tps.description: Rate limiter tokens per second threshold.

white-list.description: The list of ips to whitelist in rate limiting.

model.RemoveFilesType.description: RemoveFilesType represents the type of the backup storage.

model.RestoreJobStatus.description: RestoreJobStatus represents a restore job status.

model.RestoreNamespace.description: RestoreNamespace specifies an alternative namespace name for the restore operation.

model.RestorePolicy.description: RestorePolicy represents a policy for the restore operation.

bandwidth.description: Throttles read operations from the backup file(s) to not exceed the given I/O bandwidth in bytes/sec.

batch-size.description:
The max allowed number of records per an async batch write call.
Default is 128 with batch writes enabled, or 16 without batch writes.

bin-list.description: The bins to restore (optional, an empty list implies restoring all bins).

disable-batch-writes.description:
Disables the use of batch writes when restoring records to the Aerospike cluster.
By default, the cluster is checked for batch write support.

max-async-batches.description: The max number of outstanding async record batch write calls at a time.

namespace.description:
Namespace details for the restore operation.
By default, the data is restored to the namespace from which it was taken.

no-generation.description:
Records from backups take precedence. This option disables the generation check.
With this option, records from the backup always overwrite records that already exist in
the namespace, regardless of generation numbers.

no-indexes.description: Do not restore any secondary index definitions.

no-records.description:
Do not restore any record data (metadata or bin data).
By default, record data, secondary index definitions, and UDF modules
will be restored.

no-udfs.description: Do not restore any UDF modules.

parallel.description: The number of client threads to spawn for writing to the cluster.

replace.description:
Replace records. This controls how records from the backup overwrite existing records in
the namespace. By default, restoring a record from a backup only replaces the bins
contained in the backup; all other bins of an existing record remain untouched.

set-list.description: The sets to restore (optional, an empty list implies restoring all sets).

timeout.description: Timeout (ms) for Aerospike commands to write records, create indexes and create UDFs.

tps.description:
Throttles read operations from the backup file(s) to not exceed the given number of transactions
per second.

unique.description:
Existing records take precedence. With this option, only records that do not exist in
the namespace are restored, regardless of generation numbers. If a record exists in
the namespace, the record from the backup is ignored.

model.RestoreRequest.description: RestoreRequest represents a restore operation request.

model.RestoreTimestampRequest.description: RestoreTimestampRequest represents a restore by timestamp operation request.

destination.description: The details of the Aerospike destination cluster.

policy.description: Restore policy to use in the operation.

time.description: Required epoch time for recovery. The closest backup before the timestamp will be applied.

model.RunningJob.description: RunningJob tracks progress of currently running job.

done-records.description: DoneRecords: the number of records that have been successfully done.

estimated-end-time.description:
EstimatedEndTime: the estimated time when the backup operation will be completed.
A nil value indicates that the estimation is not available yet.

percentage-done.description: PercentageDone: the progress of the backup operation as a percentage.

start-time.description: StartTime: the time when the backup operation started.

total-records.description: TotalRecords: the total number of records to be processed.

model.SecretAgent.description: SecretAgent represents the configuration of an Aerospike Secret Agent for a backup/restore operation.

is-base64.description: Flag that shows if secret agent responses are encrypted with base64.

port.description: Port the Secret Agent is running on.

tls-ca-file.description: The path to a trusted CA certificate file in PEM format.

model.SeedNode.description: SeedNode represents details of a node in the Aerospike cluster.

host-name.description: The host name of the node.

tls-name.description: TLS certificate name used for secure connections (if enabled).

model.Storage.description: Storage represents the configuration for a backup storage details.

max_async_connections.description: The maximum number of simultaneous requests from S3.

min_part_size.description: The minimum size in bytes of individual S3 UploadParts

path.description: The root path for the backup repository.

s3-endpoint-override.description: An alternative endpoint for the S3 SDK to communicate (AWS S3 optional).

s3-log-level.description: The log level of the AWS S3 SDK (AWS S3 optional).

s3-profile.description: The S3 profile name (AWS S3 optional).

s3-region.description: The S3 region string (AWS S3 optional).

type.description: The type of the storage provider

model.StorageType.description: StorageType represents the type of the backup storage.

model.TLS.description: TLS represents the Aerospike cluster TLS configuration options.

cafile.description: Path to a trusted CA certificate file.

capath.description: Path to a directory of trusted CA certificates.

certfile.description: Path to the chain file for mutual authentication (if Aerospike Cluster supports it).

cipher-suite.description: TLS cipher selection criteria. The format is the same as OpenSSL's Cipher List Format.

keyfile.description: Path to the key for mutual authentication (if Aerospike cluster supports it).

keyfile-password.description: Password to load protected TLS-keyfile (env:VAR, file:PATH, PASSWORD).

name.description: The default TLS name used to authenticate each TLS socket connection.

protocols.description: TLS protocol selection criteria. This format is the same as Apache's SSL Protocol.
